message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about Chinese Natural Language Processing (NLP) and specifically focuses on the question of whether Chinese word segmentation (CWS) is necessary for deep learning-based NLP. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers topics related to NLP. The paper also involves benchmarking neural models and studying their performance, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses the vulnerability of word-based models to data sparsity and overfitting, which are topics related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper also involves experiments related to text classification, which falls under the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
